title: Basketball player sues Ohio college over suspension
text:
Updated: 10:21 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 | Posted: 10:21 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 Basketball player sues Ohio college over suspension Sponsored Links The Associated Press CINCINNATI â€” 
A star University of Dayton basketball player has sued the Ohio school in federal court over his suspension after a sexual assault accusation. 
Dyshawn (duh-SHAHN') Pierre's (pee-EHRZ') lawsuit asks a U.S. district court judge to order his reinstatement, and also seeks unspecified damages. The lawsuit notes that Montgomery County prosecutors declined to file charges against Pierre after what he says was a consensual sexual encounter with a female UD student last spring. 
His lawsuit filed Wednesday says the school's investigation was "fundamentally unfair" and reached a "wholly irrational, unsubstantiated" conclusion after a hearing that failed to accommodate Pierre's learning disability. 
The school declined comment on the lawsuit, but says it complies with federal requirements.
